results.content: Presentation is clear and quick, so I'm able to run at double speed. Very nice. At first, I thought it needed more "setting the stage". However, as it moves along there is more of that. However, there is a lot of coding and repeating what we can see happening on the screen. It would be fun to code so we can see, but explain why, not what, we're doing. In a couple cases, Michael does this but at a cursory level. This is as much about the concepts (clean architecture, dependency inversion, API services, etc.) as the implementation. I feel saying they won't be covered is a miss, especially when there's all this time to do so.

response.content: Thanks for your feedback! I will take note of that in my next course. Your opinion helps me do it better!
response.content_html: Thanks for your feedback! I will take note of that in my next course. Your opinion helps me do it better!

results.content: Terrible course. Long videos simply watching the guy type in code with no explanation or analysis.

response.content: Thanks for your feedback, I added more explanations before every section=)

results.content:
Great Course. Delivers on all promises.
Node.js, Express and more.

If you are unfamiliar with the Clean Code concepts - this will be a great introduction. I was familiar, so it was a great practical application for my theoretical knowledge.

Enjoy!

response.content: Thank you so much for your feedback :)
response.content_html: Thank you so much for your feedback :)

results.content: Its a good course but the style is very slow , the author is thinking what to do as he goes along , so he spends a lot of time revising function names and typing out every variable  a task , this is very time consuming and boring and could have ben much better presented.
